org.jredis.ri.alphazero
Class SynchProtocol.SynchResponseBase

java.lang.Object
  org.jredis.ri.alphazero.ProtocolBase.ResponseSupport
      org.jredis.ri.alphazero.SynchProtocol.SynchResponseBase
All Implemented Interfaces:
Message, Response
Direct Known Subclasses:
SynchProtocol.SynchBulkResponse, SynchProtocol.SynchLineResponse, SynchProtocol.SynchMultiBulkResponse
Enclosing class:
SynchProtocol
public abstract class SynchProtocol.SynchResponseBase
extends ProtocolBase.ResponseSupport

Synchronous responses are guaranteed to be continigous chuncks (if the client of this class is respecting its contract) -- meaning, it can go ahead and read as much as it can in its first read without busy waiting or reading one byte at a time. After that initial read, specialized response types can go head and read/parse as they please.

Since:
alpha.0
Version:
alpha.0, 04/02/09
Author:
Joubin Houshyar (alphazero@sensesay.net)

readBulkData

public final byte[] readBulkData(java.io.InputStream in,
                                 int length)
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 java.lang.RuntimeException
Will read up expected bulkdata bytes from the input stream. Routine will also read in the last two bytes and will check that they are indeed CRLF.

Parameters:
in - the stream to read from.
length - expected bulk data length (NOT including the trailing CRLF).
Returns:
a byte[] of length.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if could not read the bulk data
java.lang.RuntimeException
